segments.text: I notice the woman at the sink, so absorbed in her dish drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's tied neatly, and she's got that calm expression.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the water's overflowing, and it's heartbreaking to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's standing in the puddle, oblivious to the mess spreading.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool looks so determined, reaching for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool's tilting back; he could get hurt any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's waiting eagerly, her little arm up high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's sweet how they're sharing the mischief, but so risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cabinets are getting soaked; this could damage the whole kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden is blooming nicely, full of life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for them; one wrong move and it'll all go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookies in the jar look tempting, but not worth the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Wish someone would notice before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
